channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This swine life: pig named Six Seven pardoned by Miami-Dade mayor
item.description: Daniella Levine Cava wished the piglet ‘a long happy life’ in speech alluding to the several pardons issued by Trump It might not have been at the sam...

item.title: Top Democrat calls on Trump administration to release full video of ‘double-tap’ boat strike – live
item.description: House minority leader Hakeem Jeffries said that if the administration thinks that their ‘actions are justifiable, what are they hiding from the Americ...

item.title: Storm Bram batters Britain and Ireland with strong winds and heavy rain
item.description: More than 300 flood warnings or alerts across UK as homes left without power, sporting events cancelled and transport disrupted Flights, trains and fe...

item.title: Starmer urges Europe’s leaders to curb ECHR to halt rise of far right
item.description: Exclusive: PM calls for members of European convention on human rights to allow tougher action to protect borders We must protect our borders to defen...

item.title: Australia news live: X complies with social media ban as apps not included surge on Apple charts
item.description: Australians wake up with under-16s social media ban in effect. Follow the latest updates live Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news pod...

item.title: Trump criticises 'decaying' European countries and 'weak' leaders
item.description: The UK praises Europe's "strength" after Trump says countries fail to control migration or take action to end the Ukraine war.

item.title: Grooming gangs inquiry to be led by former children's commissioner Anne Longfield
item.description: Baroness Anne Longfield will chair the three-year inquiry which has been beset by problems.

item.title: Artist Nnena Kalu earns 'historic' Turner Prize win
item.description: Kalu wins for her sculptures and drawings, becoming the first learning disabled artist to scoop the award.

item.title: Fifa accused of breaching own rules with Trump award
item.description: Gianni Infantino is accused of breaking Fifa rules by a campaign group after giving United States President Donald Trump a peace prize.

item.title: Member of UK armed forces dies in accident in Ukraine
item.description: He died in an accident away from Ukraine's front lines on Tuesday, the Ministry of Defence says.
